title: The Greatest Gift
content:
First of all, let me say that I'm a Christian (and a very happy one, at that) and recently, I've felt called to give anyone on these forums who wants it an invitation to become one too.

I'll keep this message short and simple. I have a Friend named Jesus who took the punishment for my sins, your sins, and everyone else's sins in the whole world. None of us deserve to have them taken away and forgiven, but He did it anyway, entirely out of love and as a gift, "so that whosoever believes in him should not perish but have everlasting life" (John 3:16). And you can receive the greatest gift ever - eternal salvation for free - for yourself right now.

All you have to do is bow your head wherever you are and accept Jesus as your personal Savior, and rest assured that you are saved. And once again, this is simply an invitation. Anyone who doesn't want it doesn't have to become a Christian, but everyone who does will be infinitely glad they did.

title: Hmmm
content:
"... or do you only take the thing in the bible for real that you really like from a personal point of view?"
Well, definitely not. I just don't believe God has written it by Himself. I believe some of the writers were influenced by God, got kinda order or impulse to write it, but were never controlled by Him and hadn't any divine commandment to write exactly something and so on. I just don't see it's something holy collection chosen and written by God word by word, mainly because of:
[url=http://www.google.com/search?q=bible+contradictions]www.google.com/search?q=b...radictions[/url]

And, I'm pretty sure there are scriptures that aren't even by His influence, stuff that is just made up by some man to gain power or whatever desired. As well, I'm sure the actual text has changed, it has been modified for various purposes (probably by the church institution to gain power), and there are errors that have appeared because of various translatings and such. As well, I believe there are many things that the original/first Christians believed in and considered important, but they're missing for some reasons, perhaps even considered heretic now.
Bottom line is that I don't believe it's something perfect collection of books written by God Himself.

Naturally I may be wrong. But I try to base my life on what Jesus has teached and so on, not what some contradicting books exactly say. For me God is the ultimate good, and Jesus part of that while being a perfect human as well. I belive Jesus is the Saviour, and loves everyone. I'm inclined to think everyone'll 'join the party' eventually. Not even sure if there is any other kind of afterlife than heaven. I believe life has important meaning and such, and not that human is created to praise God 24/7 for all eternity. Probably the Bible doesn't even say anything like that. If it says, that's probably the belief of the certain person who has written that specific book or the belief has been his community's. Might even be that he personally gained some power from it or anything. All history is full of lies and scams. Anyways, these are things I believe in and consider important. Jesus saves, no Bible is really required.

And, I really don't care whatever you say against this. Besides I'm not the only one thinking this way. And well, it doesn't really matter even if it all would be written by God word by word, I still try living according the Bible, and most importantly, base my faith in God itself instead of some books.

Besides, there are different ways to interpret the Bible, as said. Some Christians take it literally, others read it by considering not everything true in it but there being some common truth in it such as Jesus being the Saviour that loves everyone etc..
Not to mention that there are dozens of forms of Christianity..

Edit:
"What use does the bible have if you ignore parts of it, then it's not the word of God anymore."
See above.

"He is perfect because he is God so he can't make mistakes. If he isn't then why is he better then humans?"
Who said anything about mistakes? Not me at least. Changing one's plans or opinions isn't always because of mistakes. At least in my case. And if you mean that God has made a mistake if He changes His plans, I have to disagree. I'm sure God has a free will as well.. He can choose whatever he wants to. And what makes you think God should even do anything at all? He could make mistakes if He has modified Himself capable of that. And naturally it's only your idea of error. It could be perfect plan that just goes that way and you can't understand it. We can't really explain God with our words and terms, anyway.

Another edit: Just to note that my beliefs are changing during the time. Perhaps in a few years I think Bible has no contradictions at all.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: ... Back briefly once again.
content:
I was browsing through the forum and found this.

The complete story is this.

Hell was originally created for Satan and his fallen angels, but basically anyone who disobeyed God could go there.

God gave man the choice to disobey or not to disobey and live in perfection forever. He made the tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil to give Adam the choice. There was nothing special about the tree, it was just that God was giving Adam his free will.

But Adam, knowing it was forbidden, and being tempted by Eve, bit the apple, disobeying God and allowing sin and rebellion into the world. There never would've been death if Adam hadn't bit the apple.

So basically whoever was guilty of breaking even one of God's laws was guilty of sin and had to be punished. But if you could find a substitute to take your place in Hell, then you wouldn't have to go. Problem is, I have so many of my sins I can't substitute for you and you have so many of your sins you can't substitute for me. The only person who was willing and able was Jesus Christ.

2000 years ago, God the son came to earth as a man to eventually die on the cross, go to Hell for three days then rise again. This payed the price for everyone's sin.

All you have to do is accept Jesus Christ, ask God's forgiveness and invite Jesus into your heart and you will be saved from eternal punishment. Even though we fell into sin at the beginning of the universe, God was willing to send his only son to die on the cross. All because he loves us deeply with passion, as a father loves his many children.

There are bad people and good people wether they are Christians or not, the difference is that Christians are saved (they prayed the sinner's prayer) and are born-again in the spirit, so they won't have to pay the price for their sins.

I dare you to say God isn't a merciful God or he's bad in anyway. Some people ask "Why do bad things happen to good people." Some say that God's not fair and they are totally right. If he was fair, I would get what I deserve: eternal punishment.

That's all I've got to say on that.

Now about some insignificant topics. Yes, the bible is completely correct cover to cover. There are no contradictions.

At the lifechurch.tv site go to the Q&A series to learn some things. Kent Hovind at drdino.com addresses the lie about there being contradictions in the bible, showing that there are no contradictions by studying the bible.

To die, to sleep
No more; and by a sleep, to say, we end
The heart-ache, and the thousand natural shocks
That flesh is heir to; 'tis a consummation
Devoutly to be wish'd. To die to sleep
To sleep? perchance, to dream. Ay, there's the rub;
For in that sleep of Death what dreams may come,
When we have shuffled off this mortal coil,
Must give us pause.

title: Re: And one more thing...
content:
I'm sorry LL, but the bible says otherwise about hell. 9 through 11 are the key verses but I put this all into context for you.

Revelation 19:6-7

6And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people,

7Saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.

8And there followed another angel, saying, Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.

9And the third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any man worship the beast and his image, and receive his mark in his forehead, or in his hand,

10The same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:

11And the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever: and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast (anti-christ) and his image, and whosoever receiveth the mark of his name.

12Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.

13And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.


You think that people just cease to exist huh? Let's skip to the 20th verse.


20And the beast was taken, and with him the false prophet that wrought miracles before him, with which he deceived them that had received the mark of the beast, and them that worshipped his image. These both were cast alive into a lake of fire burning with brimstone.


The key word there is alive. They were totally conscious and later in revelation it's says that those who have not accepted Jesus Christ or those who have taken the mark of the beast will share this torment.


Revelation 21:6-8

6And he said unto me, It is done. I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give unto him that is athirst of the fountain of the water of life freely.

7He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his God, and he shall be my son.

8But the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and brimstone: which is the second death.


So, LL, the bible says what the punishment is. But God does not want us to go there. Remember? He gave man free will and he disobeyed God, letting sin enter mankind and every other thing in this world. Because of man's disobedience, we have to share the devil's torment.

But God does not want that. That's why he sent Jesus Christ, the perfect sacrifice for our sins, to take our punishment. So we wouldn't have to go there. All you have to do is accept his sacrifice, ask God to forgive you and you will be saved.

Read carefully, Xtraverse.


John 14:6

6Jesus said unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man comes unto the Father, but by me.


Acts 4:12

12Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.


John 1:12

12But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name:


Romans 10:9-10

9 If you confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus and believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead, you will be saved. 10 For with the heart one believes unto righteousness, and with the mouth confession is made unto salvation.


It's your choice to believe.


Hebrews 11:1

1Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.


1 John 1:9

9If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

If any of you on this board would like to accept Jesus Christ as your Lord and savior, go here: [url=http://www.wayofthemaster.com/goodperson.shtml]Link[/url]

It will also make it a bit clearer. Remember, if the Bible is true, then obtaining eternal life couldn't be any easier.

-Dreamer
